comments.content: When that guard said "I'm doing my best" I really felt that I'm ngl
5:14 genuinely shook me, the way it finally thinks of a song in desperation to stay alive is WILD
The comedic timing by contestant number 3's "I don't know any songs" was perfect
The NPC running underneath the stairs and saying "My rod needs tending" sent me
Idk why but the line "GET OUT OF MY WIFES HOUSE" as he himself leaves is unintentionally hilarious
"are you suggesting that the jarl's steward is... involved with a barrel?!" killed me
Kevin: can you give us a song to inspire us? Lurbuk: oh I'll give you a song Lurbuk: proceeds to drop the biggest banger of the 4th era
“Always stay vigilant, always stay brave and always keep it real” - ya boi captain Aldis

Gimli: "I never thought I'd die fighting side by side with an elf." Legolas: "What about side by side with another soul you crossed paths with and had a bit of let's call it 'company' while the world tossed you about?"
The "game show" with "sentient" NPCs is literally the funniest thing I've seen this year. Keep up the good work.
I'm impressed that the AI seemed to figure out which one of the NPC's are contestant number 1, 2 and 3, reacting accordingly
When the Khajiit said "I have a song in me" I lost my marbles. It was so hilarious and fitting
It was strange to hear that guard desperately try to stop Kevin from jumping off of a bridge lmao, he might be AI but that guard is such a homie
That’s interesting that the guard knew part of his job was talking you off the ledge.
6:00 I didn't realise anyone could make this mission more cold hearted, but making him hum for his life while you dance in your chair is hilariously dark
"It's not everyday you get to spend a night with a vampire" "Play your cards right and you might to again because I'm turning into one" Kevin that was GOLD
I absolutely love the fisherman saying "lead the way" and staying put like he's just trying to get rid of Kevin. Power move.
Saying "hold on lad/lass" unironically whilst saying it's a bit harsh "not being friends" is next level
10:58 "yeah but the weather is nice" "t'is the dead of night friend" that made me laugh way to hard

Since this mod came about, I've been saying that it would be brilliant if it was fully and properly implemented in an RPG. The idea of fully immersing yourself in a character and the world and interacting with the NPCS, it could make doing quests a whole lot more interesting if they could get the characters to adapt to what you are saying. People hate the whole AI thing, but when used like this. I think it would be amazing.
"Plagiarize? I would never stoop to such a thing!" No one tell her
Contestant #1 wins by doing absolutely nothing this is bullshit i stand up for #2 a real one
I’m so glad that captin Aldis finally decided to collab with Kevin. I hope Aldis’s streaming career will pick up after this!
I like how the AI plays the NPCs like a D&D player playing a D&D character but not wanting to actually roleplay them in character.
I have to agree with Brutius, "Company" is absolutely one of the finest things to be vaguely connected to.
9:20 That "I'm doing my best!" from the guard after you jumped to your death is killing me haha.
If this becomes a series that would be amazing. I need to gather my thoughts for a moment
'PLAGERIZE i would NEVEr stoop to such a thing!' coming from AI is so hilarious and almost uncannily self aware lmao (obviously not really but at a glance could definitely look that way)
"gorm is not even a name" says the guy who names his characters gorg and grognak and such lol
i like that it took kevin all of seven minutes to turn into a batman villain
Hearing the Captain Aldis do the outro may be my favourite Kevin moment. Only Kevin could bring a fantasy guard to say "It's ya boi" and "Keep it real".
her voice sounded way more natural than other in game AI's so far, really good
2025 and not only do we still not have flying cars, we can't even smell Stella.
This is the type of stuff I thought we would have in 2040

she responded really well. it feels authentic and natural for a simple NPC in the game. I’m excited for the time when we'll have 3-4 npc AI companions joining us on adventures, traveling alongside, engaging in genuine, dynamic conversations with each other and us. add VR and online multiplayer and it will be totally next level open-world experience
"That's not how this works." If it were real life, it would be. You wouldn't be able to stop mustache. You would be a victim of the SNIFF.
Will they all say "It's not just X, but Y" in every single sentence?
Lol what would have been interesting is if he said sniffing is how my people recognize distress calls
I saw this on the Neurosama stream. The technology is actually really impressive.
"If you get me back on Earth, and depending on your income, you might have a shot at a sniff. But only the end of my ponytail."
Now the only thing it lacks is the feature which AIs play videogames in our place while we take a break and watching AIs playing videogames
Imagine this technology in situations like negotiation and conversation segments in the Deus Ex series.
Big fans of your channel - thanks so much for playing the game! btw Stella probably smells like space dust
that's so natural wtf but why he can't sniff Stella though, is it a bug

The problem with this is simply that it is extremely expensive to run large language models. So we will not get games that run locally and it is not a pay once type of deal. It is going to be costly to play games with an AI.
What if you tell her you're an alien who communicates effectively via sniffing?
i was thinking on a way for model control npc, like skyrim but at any game

NO WAY. The video game industry hasn't invested in a long time. It thrives on recycling, it thrives on savings, it thrives on profit margins. This stuff is a thing, and you won't see it in games for another 20 years.

I am not sure what LLM they are using, but for some models, if you reason enough, I am pretty sure it is gonna happen. Well, on the other hand, there are models no matter how you make sense, it rather die on Mars than follow your state of mind.
large language models shouldn´t be used for this, would be more efficient and better for user experience any other kind of IA
I would rather have a party of either all players or a mix of players and ai (still mostly players) rather than a party of ai.
This sniffing around on you is pretty awful. The AI ​​is awesome, though.
AMD is going to be left behind again if they don't manage to get in the AI race, if people can't run these things on their GPU why even have it?
This game was garbage. It had exclusively linear solutions despite a supposedly dynamic AI. That's not revolutionary. It's countless steps back.

key_facts_from_comments: FACT: The guard's line 'I'm doing my best' resonated emotionally with viewers during a tense moment.
FACT: Contestant number 3 delivered perfectly timed comedic dialogue with 'I don't know any songs'.
FACT: An NPC under the stairs said 'My rod needs tending', which was a standout humorous moment.
FACT: The line 'GET OUT OF MY WIFE'S HOUSE' became unintentionally hilarious when spoken by the departing character.
FACT: The AI correctly identified and reacted to specific contestants (number 1, 2, 3) in real time.
FACT: The Khajiit's declaration 'I have a song in me' was described as both funny and fitting.
FACT: The guard attempted to talk Kevin down from jumping off a bridge, showing unexpected emotional depth.
FACT: The AI-generated vampire’s line about turning someone into a vampire was praised as gold.
FACT: The fisherman’s response of 'lead the way' while staying put was seen as a power move.
FACT: Captain Aldis’s outro lines like 'It's ya boi' and 'Keep it real' were considered iconic Kevin moments.
FACT: The AI voice for the NPC sounded more natural than previous in-game AI voices.
FACT: The mod demonstrated dynamic NPC responses based on player input and context.
FACT: The AI reacted authentically to player actions, such as humming for survival at 6:00.
FACT: The mod was showcased on Neurosama’s stream, highlighting its technological impressiveness.
FACT: The AI’s ability to adapt dialogue based on player choices suggests potential for future RPGs.
key_opinions_from_comments: OPINION: The AI-driven NPCs feel like living characters rather than scripted bots.
OPINION: This mod proves that AI can enhance immersion in RPGs if implemented well.
OPINION: The humor in the AI’s reactions is unintentional but deeply effective.
OPINION: The AI’s self-awareness in lines like 'Plagiarize? I would never stoop to such a thing!' is hilariously ironic.
OPINION: The AI should be used in narrative-heavy games like Deus Ex for deeper conversations.
OPINION: This mod shows what future open-world games could look like with full AI integration.
OPINION: The AI’s voice feels too natural—almost too lifelike for a simple NPC.
OPINION: The AI’s behavior mimics a D&D player roleplaying without fully committing to character.
OPINION: The AI’s sniffing mechanic is absurd but entertaining, adding unique flavor.
OPINION: This technology could revolutionize how players interact with game worlds.
OPINION: The AI should not replace human players entirely; a mix of humans and AI is preferable.
OPINION: The game’s linear structure undermines the promise of dynamic AI.
OPINION: The AI’s emotional depth makes it feel more like a companion than a tool.
OPINION: The mod is ahead of its time—industry investment will lag for years.
OPINION: Large language models are inefficient for gaming and should be replaced with better alternatives.
key_datapoints_from_comments: DATA: The guard said 'I'm doing my best!' after Kevin jumped off a bridge.
DATA: The Khajiit said 'I have a song in me'—a moment described as hilarious and fitting.
DATA: At 5:14, the AI generated a desperate song attempt to stay alive.
DATA: The vampire line about turning Kevin into a vampire was called 'GOLD'.
DATA: The fisherman said 'lead the way' while refusing to move—seen as a power move.
DATA: The AI responded naturally to player input, including emotional cues.
DATA: The AI’s voice was rated as more natural than other in-game AI voices.
DATA: The mod was featured on Neurosama’s stream, indicating high visibility.
DATA: The AI reacted to Kevin’s transformation into a batman villain in just seven minutes.
DATA: The AI’s dialogue included references to 'sniffing' and 'ponytails' as part of interaction.
DATA: The AI’s response to 'I’m an alien who communicates via sniffing' was speculated upon.
DATA: The AI’s emotional depth was compared to a D&D player’s performance.
DATA: The AI’s ability to adapt to player choices was noted as groundbreaking.
DATA: The AI’s performance was praised despite concerns about computational cost.
DATA: The AI’s voice was described as sounding authentic and lifelike.
major_themes: Theme: Humor derived from AI-generated NPC dialogue and absurd situations
Theme: Emotional depth and realism in AI character behavior
Theme: Potential of AI to transform RPGs and open-world gameplay
Theme: Technical limitations and costs of running large language models in games
Theme: Preference for human-AI collaboration over fully AI-controlled parties
Theme: Critique of current game design for being linear despite AI promises
Theme: Speculation on future applications of AI in storytelling and negotiation systems
Theme: Concerns about industry innovation and long-term adoption of AI in gaming
top_engagement_markers: High-engagement comment about AI humor: 'The line "GET OUT OF MY WIFE'S HOUSE" as he himself leaves is unintentionally hilarious.'
High-engagement comment about emotional impact: 'When that guard said "I'm doing my best" I really felt that I'm ngl.'
High-engagement comment about AI realism: 'Her voice sounded way more natural than other in-game AI's so far, really good.'
High-engagement comment about future potential: 'I think it would be amazing if this was fully implemented in an RPG.'
High-engagement comment about iconic moment: 'Hearing Captain Aldis do the outro may be my favourite Kevin moment.'
High-engagement comment about technical wonder: 'I saw this on the Neurosama stream. The technology is actually really impressive.'
High-engagement comment about AI limitations: 'The problem with this is simply that it is extremely expensive to run large language models.'
High-engagement comment about industry critique: 'The video game industry hasn't invested in a long time. It thrives on recycling... you won't see it in games for another 20 years.'
